title: DOOMED / ELECTRONIC DOORBELL
description: This is a doorbell intercom that lets you call up all the failed businesses in the Doomed Commercial Area.

dialogueTree.title: Electronic Doorbell: "An old call box with a matrix of pu..."
dialogueTree.text: An old call box with a matrix of push buttons lists all the companies in the East Delta Commerce Centre.

links.title: Logic: "East Delta Commerce Centre? This mu..."
links.text: East Delta Commerce Centre? This must be the name of the Doomed Commercial Area!

links.title: You: ""Main Hall, Building A.""
links.text: "Main Hall, Building A."

links.title: Electronic Doorbell: "You hear the same waiting room musi..."
links.text: You hear the same waiting room music, but no one picks up the receiver anymore...

links.title: Electronic Doorbell: "An off-key melody starts playing af..."
links.text: An off-key melody starts playing after you ring the doorbell... Then a woman picks up the receiver...

links.title: Plaisance: ""Cuno! Please stop calling here! Gr..."
links.text: "Cuno! Please stop calling here! Grown-ups don't have time for your stupid games."

links.title: Drama: "She thinks you're the gremlin child..."
links.text: She thinks you're the gremlin child! What would he say to this?

links.title: You: "(Try to impersonate Cuno.) "Fuck of..."
links.text: (Try to impersonate Cuno.) "Fuck off, pig, I'm Cuno! I don't give a shit, let me in."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Pardon? This is not Cuno. Who *is*..."
links.text: "Pardon? This is not Cuno. Who *is* this?"

links.title: Plaisance: ""Please just stop calling here, I d..."
links.text: "Please just stop calling here, I don't have time to deal with this. Thank you."

links.title: You: ""Plaisance, it's me! I'm investigat..."
links.text: "Plaisance, it's me! I'm investigating the Doomed Commercial Area, just like we discussed!"

links.title: Plaisance: ""Oh, I'm sorry, officer, I thought..."
links.text: "Oh, I'm sorry, officer, I thought you were..." There's a spot of static that overrides her words.

links.title: Plaisance: ""...but the doorbell is broken and..."
links.text: "...but the doorbell is broken and the bookstore shouldn't even be on the list anymore, so I can't help you. Please don't call here again. Thanks."

links.title: You: ""Plaisance, it's me! Please open th..."
links.text: "Plaisance, it's me! Please open the door, I'm trying to get in."

links.title: You: ""Who's Cuno? This is the police, pl..."
links.text: "Who's Cuno? This is the police, please open the door."

links.title: You: ""This is the police, please open th..."
links.text: "This is the police, please open the door."

links.title: You: ""Sorry, I was just trying random do..."
links.text: "Sorry, I was just trying random doorbells, I didn't have anything important."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Please don't do that! Doorbells ar..."
links.text: "Please don't do that! Doorbells are not toys, and this one isn't even working properly. Please don't call us again, thank you."

links.title: Electronic Doorbell: "A single beep indicates that the li..."
links.text: A single beep indicates that the line has gone dead.

links.title: You: ""Andro-Orlando Hair SCA.""
links.text: "Andro-Orlando Hair SCA."

links.title: Electronic Doorbell: "You ring the doorbell, but no one a..."
links.text: You ring the doorbell, but no one answers.

links.title: Conceptualization: "What an ominous name for a hair sal..."
links.text: What an ominous name for a hair salon... Doesn't bode well for anyone's hair.

links.title: Half Light: "Just seeing the words "Andro-Orland..."
links.text: Just seeing the words "Andro-Orlando" gets your hackles up. It's very existence is a *threat* to your masculinity, to say nothing of your hair.

links.title: You: ""ARTEMITEP's Boxing for Young Athle..."
links.text: "ARTEMITEP's Boxing for Young Athletes & Gym."

links.title: Electronic Doorbell: "Congratulations, you've destroyed A..."
links.text: Congratulations, you've destroyed Artemitep's Boxing Club's doorbell. It's not working anymore.

links.title: Electronic Doorbell: "All you hear is static, but no one..."
links.text: All you hear is static, but no one answers the call.

links.title: You: ""24h Window.""
links.text: "24h Window."

links.title: Electronic Doorbell: "You ring the doorbell, but nothing..."
links.text: You ring the doorbell, but nothing happens.

links.title: Interfacing: "Try again, you didn't press it hard..."
links.text: Try again, you didn't press it hard enough.

links.title: You: "Press again."
links.text: Press again.

links.title: Electronic Doorbell: "This time a pleasant female voice a..."
links.text: This time a pleasant female voice answers: "Thank you for calling 24h Window Company. This is an automated message. Are you experiencing a window-related emergency? During non-business-hours, please call 0-0-7-2-5-4-7-7-6-5-1. The streets are mean, but we're *always* there for you."

links.title: Logic: "That's only half-true. The streets..."
links.text: That's only half-true. The streets *are* mean, but they're not there for you.

links.title: You: ""Actually, I *do have* a window-rel..."
links.text: "Actually, I *do have* a window-related emergency." (Look at Whirling's second floor.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, I've been meaning to ask abou..."
links.text: "Yes, I've been meaning to ask about that... What happened?"

links.title: Rhetoric: "This was no mere act of vandalism -..."
links.text: This was no mere act of vandalism -- this was a defenestration!

links.title: You: ""A SHOE WAS DEFENESTRATED!""
links.text: "A SHOE WAS DEFENESTRATED!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I see." There is an impenetrable e..."
links.text: "I see." There is an impenetrable expression on the lieutenant's face.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""In any case, I'm afraid you won't..."
links.text: "In any case, I'm afraid you won't get any help here." He looks up to the towering ghost house. "This place is deserted."

links.title: You: ""I threw my shoe out the window.""
links.text: "I threw my shoe out the window."

links.title: You: ""Some crook threw a shoe into my wi..."
links.text: "Some crook threw a shoe into my window."

links.title: You: ""Some crook threw a shoe into my wi..."
links.text: "Some crook threw a shoe into my window -- and forced a bottle of Commodore Red on me."

links.title: You: ""I have no idea. I just know that m..."
links.text: "I have no idea. I just know that my room's window is broken and needs to be dealt with."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I see." The lieutenant doesn't ask..."
links.text: "I see." The lieutenant doesn't ask more.

links.title: Electronic Doorbell: "There's no one there to answer your..."
links.text: There's no one there to answer your call. You are beyond help.

links.title: You: ""Kim, do we have an emergency?""
links.text: "Kim, do we have an emergency?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No, not a window-related one.""
links.text: "No, not a window-related one."

links.title: You: ""No emergencies, thank you." (Look..."
links.text: "No emergencies, thank you." (Look at other buttons again.)

links.title: You: "Ignore it."
links.text: Ignore it.

links.title: Electronic Doorbell: "Twelve name cards on the call box r..."
links.text: Twelve name cards on the call box read:

links.title: You: ""Emma's Fashion Atelier.""
links.text: "Emma's Fashion Atelier."

links.title: Electronic Doorbell: "You wait for a minute or two, but a..."
links.text: You wait for a minute or two, but all you get from the call box is silence -- no one answers the call.

links.title: You: ""Fabron's Taxi..." (The rest has be..."
links.text: "Fabron's Taxi..." (The rest has been burned off.)

links.title: Electronic Doorbell: "Looks like someone has melted half..."
links.text: Looks like someone has melted half the plastic off with a lighter -- the doorbell doesn't work anymore.

links.title: You: ""Slipstream SCA.""
links.text: "Slipstream SCA."

links.title: Electronic Doorbell: "You hear static from the intercom s..."
links.text: You hear static from the intercom speaker. It sounds as if someone has picked up the receiver, but isn't saying anything.

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "You can almost hear them breathe."
links.text: You can almost hear them breathe.

links.title: You: ""Hello? Is anyone there?""
links.text: "Hello? Is anyone there?"

links.title: Tricentennial Electrics: ""Yes, hello, this is Tricentennial..."
links.text: "Yes, hello, this is Tricentennial Electrics." This is a woman's voice, crackling and fragile through the static.

links.title: Tricentennial Electrics: ""Have you come to place an order?""
links.text: "Have you come to place an order?"

links.title: Conceptualization: "She sounds almost antique, as if he..."
links.text: She sounds almost antique, as if her voice was being played off an old wax cylinder. Her receiver must not be working properly.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Wait! But what happened to Slipstre..."
links.text: Wait! But what happened to Slipstream SCA? There's no Tricentennial Electrics on the list.

links.title: You: ""Hold on, Tricentennial Electrics?..."
links.text: "Hold on, Tricentennial Electrics? I thought I was calling Slipstream SCA."

links.title: Tricentennial Electrics: ""My god...""
links.text: "My god..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant exchanges a look wit..."
links.text: The lieutenant exchanges a look with you.

links.title: You: ""Sorry?""
links.text: "Sorry?"

links.title: Tricentennial Electrics: ""It's you. My god, I didn't think I..."
links.text: "It's you. My god, I didn't think I would hear your voice again..."

links.title: Electrochemistry: "It's a woman and she knows you! You..."
links.text: It's a woman and she knows you! Your heart beats faster.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "She must be mistaking you for someo..."
links.text: She must be mistaking you for someone else.

links.title: Drama: "Who cares that you don't remember h..."
links.text: Who cares that you don't remember her? Just go along with it.

links.title: Inland Empire: "No, something's wrong here... are y..."
links.text: No, something's wrong here... are you sure she's talking to *you*?

links.title: You: ""Do we know each other?""
links.text: "Do we know each other?"

links.title: Tricentennial Electrics: ""Michel, just please..." She stops..."
links.text: "Michel, just please..." She stops and you can hear her breathe heavily. Her breath distorted by ancient static.

links.title: Shivers: "Sounds like a ghost. Wind blows thr..."
links.text: Sounds like a ghost. Wind blows through your clothes and you feel detached from your surroundings. Inside the building -- a cold memory hangs.

links.title: Tricentennial Electrics: ""Why did you even call? I don't und..."
links.text: "Why did you even call? I don't understand... You've been gone for months." She sounds like she's shaking. "I thought you didn't care."

links.title: You: ""Michel? My name's not Michel. I'm..."
links.text: "Michel? My name's not Michel. I'm Harry."

links.title: Tricentennial Electrics: ""Ever since I came to work here it'..."
links.text: "Ever since I came to work here it's been different... as if my mind's been wiped clean..."

links.title: Tricentennial Electrics: "A spot of static overrides her word..."
links.text: A spot of static overrides her words; when she speaks again it sounds like she's submerged:

links.title: Tricentennial Electrics: ""...It's so nice.""
links.text: "...It's so nice."

links.title: Tricentennial Electrics: ""It's so nice to be able to finally..."
links.text: "It's so nice to be able to finally forget."

links.title: You: ""Forget about what?""
links.text: "Forget about what?"

links.title: Tricentennial Electrics: "She sounds like she's about to cry."
links.text: She sounds like she's about to cry.

links.title: Shivers: "The cold is deep under your skin, a..."
links.text: The cold is deep under your skin, as if you were talking to someone who's a hundred years away. Somewhere inside the building water is flooding the cellar floor.

links.title: You: ""Hello?""
links.text: "Hello?"

links.title: Tricentennial Electrics: "She doesn't answer."
links.text: She doesn't answer.

links.title: You: ""Hey, are you still there?""
links.text: "Hey, are you still there?"

links.title: Tricentennial Electrics: "Silence. The only thing you can hea..."
links.text: Silence. The only thing you can hear now is static and waves, washing ashore on the bay.

links.title: You: ""What just happened?""
links.text: "What just happened?"

links.title: Tricentennial Electrics: "Another seagull passes by... It's g..."
links.text: Another seagull passes by... It's getting cold standing here, staring at the silent call box.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I don't know what happened either...."
links.text: "I don't know what happened either." The lieutenant inspects the doorbell. "We should probably stop playing with this thing."

links.title: You: ""I get it, you don't want to talk t..."
links.text: "I get it, you don't want to talk to me. No one *ever* wants to talk to me."

links.title: Tricentennial Electrics: "Another seagull passes by... It's g..."
links.text: Another seagull passes by... It's getting cold standing here, staring at the silent call box.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It must have been some kind of......"
links.text: "It must have been some kind of... faulty wiring. We should maybe stop playing with this doorbell, it looks ancient."

links.title: You: ""Fuck!" (Hang up the call.)"
links.text: "Fuck!" (Hang up the call.)

links.title: You: ""Alright, it's a good-bye then." (H..."
links.text: "Alright, it's a good-bye then." (Hang up the call.)

links.title: You: ""You said it was nice. What's so ni..."
links.text: "You said it was nice. What's so nice about forgetting?"

links.title: You: ""Oh god, please don't cry.""
links.text: "Oh god, please don't cry."

links.title: You: "Hang up the call."
links.text: Hang up the call.

links.title: You: ""Listen, I'm going to hang up now.""
links.text: "Listen, I'm going to hang up now."

links.title: You: ""Hold on, tell me what's going on...."
links.text: "Hold on, tell me what's going on. What did I do?"

links.title: You: ""Of course I care. It's just that I..."
links.text: "Of course I care. It's just that I've been going through some tough time."

links.title: You: ""Who are you? *Where* are you?""
links.text: "Who are you? *Where* are you?"

links.title: You: ""Khm-khm..." (Stand up straighter.)..."
links.text: "Khm-khm..." (Stand up straighter.) "Yeah, it's *me*. Here I am again, crawling back into your life."

links.title: You: ""This is the police, I need you to..."
links.text: "This is the police, I need you to let me in because I heard there's a fridge in the cellar."

links.title: You: ""Yes, hello, can you let me inside..."
links.text: "Yes, hello, can you let me inside the building please?"

links.title: You: ""Who is this? I've been inside this..."
links.text: "Who is this? I've been inside this building, but I didn't see anyone from Tricentennial Electrics. This place is deserted."

links.title: You: "(Lie.) "Yes, I've come to place an..."
links.text: (Lie.) "Yes, I've come to place an order."

links.title: You: ""Sorry, I don't actually have any b..."
links.text: "Sorry, I don't actually have any business here."

links.title: You: "Hang up the call."
links.text: Hang up the call.

links.title: Electronic Doorbell: "You press the number sign on the ke..."
links.text: You press the number sign on the keypad that terminates the call. Twelve name cards on the call box read:

links.title: You: ""Slipstream SCA.""
links.text: "Slipstream SCA."

links.title: Volition: "Whatever she says, it can't hurt yo..."
links.text: Whatever she says, it can't hurt you. You're a different person now. Stronger, healthier and...

links.title: Volition: "Alright, maybe not *healthier*, but..."
links.text: Alright, maybe not *healthier*, but it's a *bonus* that you've drunk so hard you can't remember any of your past relationships. Oblivion's the ace in your corner.

links.title: You: "Call her again. (Press the doorbell..."
links.text: Call her again. (Press the doorbell to Slipstream SCA.)

links.title: Electronic Doorbell: "There's a light buzz as you press t..."
links.text: There's a light buzz as you press the doorbell, waiting for her to answer the call. It's cold outside, and you can hear the wind blowing into the speaker.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "A strange, metallic taste fills you..."
links.text: A strange, metallic taste fills your mouth, as you stare at the intercom.

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "There's the static again, whisperin..."
links.text: There's the static again, whispering like a seashell pressed against the ear.

links.title: Tricentennial Electrics: ""Yes, hello, this is Tricentennial..."
links.text: "Yes, hello, this is Tricentennial Electrics." It's the same voice you heard before. "Have you come to place an order?"

links.title: You: ""Hi, it's me again. I wanted to tal..."
links.text: "Hi, it's me again. I wanted to talk to you."

links.title: Tricentennial Electrics: ""My god...""
links.text: "My god..."

links.title: Volition: "Here come the bad vibes again. Rela..."
links.text: Here come the bad vibes again. Relax. Distance yourself from it.

links.title: You: ""What?""
links.text: "What?"

links.title: Tricentennial Electrics: "Before you can finish your sentence..."
links.text: Before you can finish your sentence the voice continues speaking: "It's you..."

links.title: Tricentennial Electrics: ""My god, I didn't think I would hea..."
links.text: "My god, I didn't think I would hear your voice again."

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Wait, is she...?"
links.text: Wait, is she...?

links.title: You: ""Wait, are you repeating your words?""
links.text: "Wait, are you repeating your words?"

links.title: Tricentennial Electrics: ""Michel, just please..." Even her b..."
links.text: "Michel, just please..." Even her breathing, the way her voice drops when she finishes the sentence sounds exactly the same.

links.title: Tricentennial Electrics: ""Why did you even call? I don't und..."
links.text: "Why did you even call? I don't understand... You've been gone for months," she continues. "I thought you didn't care."

links.title: Drama: "Is this some kind of joke?"
links.text: Is this some kind of joke?

links.title: You: ""Do you think it's *funny*, deceivi..."
links.text: "Do you think it's *funny*, deceiving a police officer?"

links.title: Tricentennial Electrics: "The voice from the intercom doesn't..."
links.text: The voice from the intercom doesn't answer, but you can hear her breathing. Wind blows into your microphone again, crackling and echoing in the box.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Your hands are getting cold and you..."
links.text: Your hands are getting cold and your breathing becomes visible, forming small silvery puffs in the air.

links.title: You: ""Is it over? Can we talk now?""
links.text: "Is it over? Can we talk now?"

links.title: Tricentennial Electrics: ""Ever since I came to work here it'..."
links.text: "Ever since I came to work here it's been different..."

links.title: Tricentennial Electrics: ""As if my mind's been wiped clean...""
links.text: "As if my mind's been wiped clean..."

links.title: You: "Say nothing."
links.text: Say nothing.

links.title: Tricentennial Electrics: ""It's so nice.""
links.text: "It's so nice."

links.title: Tricentennial Electrics: ""It's so nice to be able to finally..."
links.text: "It's so nice to be able to finally forget about you."

links.title: Volition: "And then it hits you."
links.text: And then it hits you.

links.title: You: ""You're a recording.""
links.text: "You're a recording."

links.title: Tricentennial Electrics: "She tries again not to cry. And *st..."
links.text: She tries again not to cry. And *still* doesn't succeed completely. Her quiet sobs sound old and distant, as if her voice is being played off a wax cylinder.

links.title: Empathy: "Real or not, your mirror neurons re..."
links.text: Real or not, your mirror neurons react: it feels painful to be listening to this.

links.title: Half Light: "Anger boils up in your chest..."
links.text: Anger boils up in your chest...

links.title: You: ""Just a recording... and here I tho..."
links.text: "Just a recording... and here I thought..."

links.title: Tricentennial Electrics: "Her sound melts into the static fro..."
links.text: Her sound melts into the static from a long-distance phone call. From time to time you can hear people talking in the distance, but can't make out any words.

links.title: Volition: "This is where you hung up the call..."
links.text: This is where you hung up the call the last time, but the recording is still going.

links.title: You: "Keep listening."
links.text: Keep listening.

links.title: Tricentennial Electrics: "A phone rings in the office with an..."
links.text: A phone rings in the office with an old-fashioned chime and someone walks by in a pair of heels. The static is like a warm blanket wrapped around the sounds.

links.title: You: ""Is anyone there?""
links.text: "Is anyone there?"

links.title: Tricentennial Electrics: "No one replies, but the static grow..."
links.text: No one replies, but the static grows stronger like rainfall. Then a female voice speaks out, completely different from the one before. Glorious and *total* somehow. Crawling inside your head.

links.title: Shivers: "FOR THREE HUNDRED YEARS I HAVE BEEN..."
links.text: FOR THREE HUNDRED YEARS I HAVE BEEN HERE. VOLATILE AND LUMINOUS. MADE OF SODIUM AND RAIN.

links.title: Shivers: "IF YOU WANT ME YOU CAN FIND ME ON T..."
links.text: IF YOU WANT ME YOU CAN FIND ME ON THE BEACH, DANS LE DERNIER BAL.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""So..." The strange, alien thought..."
links.text: "So..." The strange, alien thought pattern ends. The lieutenant cuts in, inspecting the intercom.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It was a recording trapped in the..."
links.text: "It was a recording trapped in the circuitry. From some ancient tenant. This sometimes happens. Shall we conclude here? We have other mysteries to solve."

links.title: You: ""Wait, a recording trapped in the c..."
links.text: "Wait, a recording trapped in the circuitry?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Mhmh. I don't have time to explain..."
links.text: "Mhmh. I don't have time to explain it to you right now. Maybe some time later..." He looks at the sea, almost wistful.

links.title: You: ""Something *weird* just happened to..."
links.text: "Something *weird* just happened to me."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Don't take this the wrong way, but..."
links.text: "Don't take this the wrong way, but -- during our short stint working together -- *something weird* is almost always happening to you."

links.title: Logic: "That *is* true."
links.text: That *is* true.

links.title: You: ""What is happening to me?""
links.text: "What is happening to me?"

links.title: Electronic Doorbell: "The strange and alien thought patte..."
links.text: The strange and alien thought pattern ends. You're left staring at the electronic doorbell.

links.title: You: "(Just hang up the call.)"
links.text: (Just hang up the call.)

links.title: Shivers: "Her words are too cold to comprehen..."
links.text: Her words are too cold to comprehend. She smells of sodium lights and rain streaks on car windows. Eyes like pilot lights watch your shape in dark hallways, guttering.

links.title: You: ""Why does it still feel like it's *..."
links.text: "Why does it still feel like it's *my* fault?"

links.title: You: ""Go ahead, ancient recording. Cry t..."
links.text: "Go ahead, ancient recording. Cry then."

links.title: You: "(Hang up the call.)"
links.text: (Hang up the call.)

links.title: Electronic Doorbell: "You press the number sign on the ke..."
links.text: You press the number sign on the keypad that terminates the call. Twelve name cards on the call box read:

links.title: You: ""Thank you. Now tell me, who's resp..."
links.text: "Thank you. Now tell me, who's responsible for this *joke*?"

links.title: You: ""Just stop it already! Stop repeati..."
links.text: "Just stop it already! Stop repeating your words!"

links.title: You: ""It doesn't matter what I say, you'..."
links.text: "It doesn't matter what I say, you're just going to continue, right?"

links.title: You: ""Didn't you already say that the la..."
links.text: "Didn't you already say that the last time we talked?"

links.title: You: ""Please don't hang up. I just want..."
links.text: "Please don't hang up. I just want to explain myself."

links.title: You: ""Last time we talked there was some..."
links.text: "Last time we talked there was some confusion. You got me mixed up with someone else."

links.title: You: ""Can you let me in please? I need t..."
links.text: "Can you let me in please? I need to get inside this building."

links.title: Volition: "No, hold on. The last thing you nee..."
links.text: No, hold on. The last thing you need in your life is more hysteric emotions. Forget it. Find something else to do.

links.title: You: ""Fortress Accident SCA.""
links.text: "Fortress Accident SCA."

links.title: Electronic Doorbell: "Silence. No one's home at Fortress..."
links.text: Silence. No one's home at Fortress Accident.

links.title: Shivers: "They have failed."
links.text: They have failed.

links.title: You: ""REVACHOL ICE CITY.""
links.text: "REVACHOL ICE CITY."

links.title: Electronic Doorbell: "Silence. No one answers the doorbel..."
links.text: Silence. No one answers the doorbell.

links.title: You: ""Main hall, building B: WHIRLING-IN..."
links.text: "Main hall, building B: WHIRLING-IN-RAGS."

links.title: Electronic Doorbell: "Nothing happens after you ring the..."
links.text: Nothing happens after you ring the doorbell... They don't want to talk to you.

links.title: Half Light: "You're going to just stand there an..."
links.text: You're going to just stand there and *take it* from a doorbell?

links.title: You: "No way. I should beat the spark int..."
links.text: No way. I should beat the spark into it. (Punch the doorbell.)

links.title: Electronic Doorbell: "Your fist crashes into the metal, p..."
links.text: Your fist crashes into the metal, pure physical vengeance. It feels good, at first, and then it starts to hurt.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You just keep on beating those thi..."
links.text: "You just keep on beating those things, don't you?"

links.title: You: ""Yes, I am the destroyer.""
links.text: "Yes, I am the destroyer."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant sighs but says nothi..."
links.text: The lieutenant sighs but says nothing. He looks up at the building.

links.title: You: ""No, I have explicitly stated that..."
links.text: "No, I have explicitly stated that I am not the destroyer."

links.title: You: "Say nothing. You've already taught..."
links.text: Say nothing. You've already taught the doorbell a lesson.

links.title: You: "No, I'll show you how a gentleman t..."
links.text: No, I'll show you how a gentleman treats a doorbell! (Kiss the doorbell.)

links.title: Electronic Doorbell: "Like a cat's whiskers, your moustac..."
links.text: Like a cat's whiskers, your moustache feels it first, followed by your lips: the corroded metal of the intercom, cold, unattainable. Now you're kissing the doorbell. The doorbell remains silent.

links.title: Inland Empire: "When was the last time you kissed?"
links.text: When was the last time you kissed?

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Khm..." says the lieutenant. "That..."
links.text: "Khm..." says the lieutenant. "That's unsanitary." (It probably is.)

links.title: You: "I should just leave the doorbell al..."
links.text: I should just leave the doorbell alone.

links.title: Electronic Doorbell: "The doorbell agrees. The entire cal..."
links.text: The doorbell agrees. The entire call box looks relieved.

links.title: You: ""East Delta Pinball (Entrance from..."
links.text: "East Delta Pinball (Entrance from building B)."

links.title: Electronic Doorbell: "Silence. No one answers your call."
links.text: Silence. No one answers your call.

links.title: You: "(Empty card.)"
links.text: (Empty card.)

links.title: Electronic Doorbell: "This button looks new, but someone..."
links.text: This button looks new, but someone has removed the name card. Nothing happens when you try to ring it.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Hmm... this button looks new. I wo..."
links.text: "Hmm... this button looks new. I wouldn't be surprised if it hasn't been connected yet. Is it the dicemaker's?" He takes a step back, inspecting the other names on the list.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Hmm... this button looks new. It's..."
links.text: "Hmm... this button looks new. It's probably not connected yet." He takes a step back, inspecting the other names on the list.

links.title: You: "[Leave.]"
links.text: [Leave.]
